page.title: 09River-keeper 2:The Deverills
page.content: {The River-keeper}looks after the river so that it is the best habitat for trout.The stretch of{the River Wylye he cares for is fished for{brown trout by a syndicate of fourteen rods. The trout season lasts from the 15th of April until the 15th of October. The River-keeper has records of all the fish taken from the river, usually between 500-600 trout a year. The river is not restocked, all the fish in the river are wild and have bred naturally. The nearby trout farm stocks Canadian rainbow trout and these develop twice as fast as the native brown trout. If rainbow trout escape they would drive away the native trout and so they must be regarded as vermin and taken out of the river. This is a very beautiful stretch of the river to spend a working life.
